title: New Mexico Firm Recalls Beef Jerky Products Produced Without the Benefit of Inspection and Misbranded With Undeclared Allergens
summary: WASHINGTON, Sept. 12, 2014 Jerky By Art, an Albuquerque, N.M. establishment, is recalling an undetermined amount of beef jerky products because they were produced without the benefit of inspection, the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. In addition, the...
impacted_products: All vacuum-packed plastic bags of Claude’s Beef Jerky with Red Chile
